website_summaries.verdict: A quiet, quality pet fountain priced in the mid-range.
pros: Three-level design includes flowing water to pets of varying sizes, or good for growing with your pet as it goes from baby to adult
cons: Prone to mold and slime buildup if not cleaned regularly

customer_reviews.title: Cat Approved!
customer_reviews.text: We have cat food and water in both the kitchen and my bedroom. I put this fountain in my bedroom, and my cat goes out of his way to drink out of it when he's thirsty. That deserves five stars. The flowing water definitely tastes better than the stagnant puddles found in regular water dishes. I clean mine probably twice a week or so. The white color makes it easy to spot dirty water, and the size allows the clean water to last a few days. My cat loves it, so I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Better luck to the next buyer of this fountain!
customer_reviews.text: My 7 cats and 3 dogs love water fountains. I use reverse osmosis water in them. I believe it helps them to stay healthy. I have a large one and this one. It was chugging away this morning (noisily) so I took it apart, disassembled the pump, scrubbed the parts with a toothbrush and other cleaning brushes, reassembled it and now it doesn't pump. This is the second one. I blamed myself for the first fountain failure but I know that this one is not my fault. I will be shopping for an alternative fountain. Daisy the border collie is frustrated it's not flowing, so are Maggie, Ginny, Heidi, Chopper, Johnny et al.
customer_reviews.author: lorrie

customer_reviews.title: Before you buy a new pump, try this!
customer_reviews.text: This is a handy and QUIET pump that the animals went to immediately. As noted by others, the water needs to be changed frequently and the parts need to be washed at such times, even if a filter is used (I buy purified water by the gallon which is helpful). The pump stopped working after a few months, and I was ready to order a new pump. In the search process I found instructions on how to clean the actual parts within the pump. After a very simple cleaning process the pump started working immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Peter A. Goodell

customer_reviews.title: AniMate has original pumps
customer_reviews.text: I asked about replacing a pump in the pet fountain I purchased almost 3 years ago. I had ordered a replacement pump from Amazon that was too large and had to be returned. When I asked the question, I received several replies, but Ani Mate must also follow their products. They contacted me; the pump/fountain was still under a 3 year warranty, so was shipped a new replacement pump in less than a week. They also supplied a return address label. I could not be more pleased, and I hope that other Cat Mate product purchasers will know they can get original parts for their products.
customer_reviews.author: Billie L. McClure

customer_reviews.title: Clean it often, slimy all the time
customer_reviews.text: At first it seemed fine. After several weeks of use and almost constant buzzing for water the thing needs cleaning just about all the time. Get filters, you will need them. If your cats like to drip food in the water or use their paws their hair will clog this thing up fairly quickly. When I wash it, the slime all over the thing is disgusting. It just does not stay clean like my previous tank style unit did. Going to buy the old style again, this one just doesnt hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Brittian household

customer_reviews.title: Great product great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Our cat refused to drink standing water so this was an excellent option suggested by our vet. We really find that she drinks more with this fountain. Additionally, this seller/manufacturer was extremely helpful when the pump stopped working after 7 months. They walked us through cleaning it out properly so that now we know for the future how to maintain it. It's working like brand new again without the hassle of shipping and And a returns department or repairs. Excellent Seller. Great product. And the replacement filters are not overpriced or difficult to get.
customer_reviews.author: S. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Bad Pump Motors
customer_reviews.text: I love this fountain but have had it just over a year and it is not working. I have bought two different replacement pumps and it still doesn't work. The cord is in two sections, one end with pump the other with plug. The replacement pump only comes with the pump end. The plug end must be defective. I can't find how to contact the manufacturer nor can I find how to purchase a replacement with the plug section of this cord. Completely frustrating. I've read about the Petmate/Catmate pumps and I recommend not to purchase this product unless you don't mind purchasing a new one every year.
customer_reviews.author: jrachelle

customer_reviews.title: STOPPED WORKING 5 DAYS AFTER RETURN WINDOW CLOSED
customer_reviews.text: This is an expensive piece of JUNK. I have 4 cats, none of whom even preferred it over a bowl of water. It was a stupid purchase. I thought it might be an extra measure of safety while we were on vacation. My pet sitter said it was mostly unused. She refilled the gravity bowl of my other cat fountain several times. And this morning... 5 days after I could return, it has stopped working. I read reviews of others who had the same experience. I was cheated out of $30 by my own stupidity. Don't you be foolish too.
customer_reviews.author: gardenburd

customer_reviews.title: Why is this happening?
customer_reviews.text: I love this fountain. It's my sixth one. The only problem I have is that after seven months, it is almost impossible to keep it clean. I clean it every week and change the filter every week and within days this funky buildup happens. Does anybody else have this problem? Am I doing something wrong..
customer_reviews.author: Jodi

customer_reviews.title: I bought this fountain in May 2016, had to ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this fountain in May 2016, had to replace the motor in January 2017. I plugged it in today after its WEEKLY cleaning and the motor does not work again. Is there any pet fountain that lasts more than one year?????? I have gone through 4 fountains in the the last 4 years. I clean them weekly and change the filters every 2 weeks because I have 2 cats.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I Would Highly Recommend This Water Fountain If Your Cat Is Too Bourgeois For A Bowl...Like My Cat
customer_reviews.text: About 2-3 years ago, I bought this same model of cat water fountain at PetSmart. It was easy clean, assemble/disassemble, filters are reasonably priced, and, most importantly, my cat would drink from it. Because of these reasons, I bought this one to replace it. The only 2 issues I've had is that: 1) the original water pump went bad about 6 months ago and 2) because hard plastic degrades over time, the cat water fountain will slowly become more porous, thus allowing for more places for harmful bacteria and other microorganisms to grow. But, these are wear-and-tear related issues, so I can't fault the company for that and highly recommend this cat water fountain.
customer_reviews.author: B.C.Wilhite

customer_reviews.title: Finally drinking enough water!!
customer_reviews.text: Thanks to this product, my two kittens are finally drinking enough water. I had one of the water dispensers that held lots of water at first but they didn't really drink from it much. I noticed the water isn't as "fresh". So I bought this water fountain and they love it! I have my kittens on both dry and wet food. So it's important for them to drink enough water. I'm able to track how much water they drink with this fountain. It's also super quiet and the filter is really good. The water is extremely clear. This is a must buy if your cats prefer cleaner, fresher, and moving water.
customer_reviews.author: Christina tran

customer_reviews.title: Not for the skittish
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about a year ago; GOOD product. Works well and makes virtually no noise when the water level is properly topped off. One problem, however, and this has nothing to do with the unit: my cats, two rescue ferals, will have nothing to do with it when it's running. They seem to be unsure about the moving water and refuse to go near it. Therefore, it is now sitting in my kitchen, unplugged and full of water, serving the same purpose as any bowl from the Dollar Store would. So this is the sole purpose of my review: if you have skittish ferals like I do, you may want to rethink this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie O

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet and holds a lot of water!
customer_reviews.text: Just set this up today. We just moved and the new place has a sunroom my cat will spend the entirety of his day now. As such he waits until he is dying of thirst, comes inside to inhale water, then immediately vomit. We have a water fountain from a different brand, but it took several returns to get one that didn’t leak. So I got this one for the sunroom. It’s very quiet, I can’t hear the motor or water noise as much as my old one. Super easy set up and holds a lot of water. Will update if it begins to have any problems. At least my sunroom living cat approves for now.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Not sold on the suction/filtration aspect
customer_reviews.text: My cats took to this immediately and I was just getting ready to buy another one when I realized there are a lot of hairs floating and few other bits on the bottom of the bowl. It was my understanding that this is the crap the filter is supposed to be getting rid of? I have it on the strongest flow and I add water everyday because I have 3 cats. Honestly though, if I was going to have to change the water everyday to get the "floaters" out, I'd just stick with my regular water dish. Maybe with just one cat it would be different?
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Are they drinking more or is the water evaporating faster?
customer_reviews.text: The fountain works great and the cats had no trouble adapting to it. (We had a bubbling fountain previously). However, it seems to go through water a lot faster than the other one. The difference in reservoir sizes is minimal (2 L vs. 2.5L) so we're not sure why. If our cats are drinking more, that's great. If it's evaporation, the manufacturer might want to consider increasing the size of the reservoir or adding a removable/refillable reservoir for a longer time between refills. Filters work great and really cut down on floating debris - cats aren't as clean as they'd like you to think LOL! Overall, we are very pleased with the quality and functionality of the pet fountain.
customer_reviews.author: R. Park

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE
customer_reviews.text: This is the third cat fountain I am trying for my cats and by far this is the worst. Though I liked the capacity and that it was relatively easy to clean, it is awful at filtering water, constantly gets clogged, and has given two of my cats chin acne - which i hadn't even known was a thing and never had an issue before with any other fountain (having previously used catit). I am sad to have wasted my money on two of these fountains as well as a great deal of time cleaning them and for extra (useless) filters. Do not do it!
customer_reviews.author: aojrcw

customer_reviews.title: Cat love it but it's not enduring; However...
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: Went in search of the model # so I could buy a new pump. Found on the old pump's cord directions for what to do if it stops. Smart people! It's soaking in the vinegar solution right now. If this works and it starts up again, I'll repost a new update. Praying it works! After a little over a year, it died. Now I'm stuck.with a partial box of carbon filters that fit in nothing else. So, it's either throw them out or buy a new one of these, I'll look around first. For $30 it should have lastsed longer. Clearly, my expectations were too high.
customer_reviews.author: 10BirdGirl

customer_reviews.title: So great, noiseless, I bought a second.
customer_reviews.text: This only makes noise when the water level gets too low or it needs to be cleaned. It's a pretty faint noise, so you'll want to keep it filled and listen for a slight suction sound, like the motor is having a hard time pulling in water. That's when it needs to be cleaned. It's completely wonderful, so I bought a second one. The cats LOVE IT. I have a kitten with one eye, so she can't see the top of the water when it's just in a bowl, so this is great for her. I also have a blind cat and while we can't hear the fountain, he can. So, he always knows where to find water.
customer_reviews.author: TMooreKajiwara

customer_reviews.title: Get something else. This wont last too much beyond the return window.
customer_reviews.text: The fountain stopped working in the first week of operation. There was no visible broken items or problems. I returned it to amazon and got a replacement. I thought the first one was a fluke which can happen to any product but i was very wrong. The replacement lasted just beyond when the return window closed for the product. I followed the instructions on dipping the pump in water/vinegar solution to descale. That was not the issue and now i have an expensive static water bowl. The product has some quality issues which may be new or old, i have no clue. Skip it and get something else.
customer_reviews.author: M. Nawaz

customer_reviews.title: My Cats Love It!
customer_reviews.text: Just as soon as I set this up, it was a hit with the cats. They love the moving water and different cats prefer different levels to drink from. Cleaning is easy, too. Once a month I disassemble it, run the parts through the dishwasher, and we're good to go. Sometimes during the month I pull a little cat hair out of the filter but that's not really necessary. I keep their old water dishes topped off as a back up, but they are rarely used. This product gets the total cat endorsement!
customer_reviews.author: R. WINN

customer_reviews.title: My cat likes it
customer_reviews.text: My cat is very elderly. Our vet suggested a fountain to encourage him to drink more. I chose this one based on reviews, and of course, price. I am very satisfied so far. It is very quiet. I only gave 4 stars for ease of cleaning because I haven't yet tried to disassemble and clean the pump. The rest of it is easy to clean. My old boy took to it right away and drinks from all 3 reservoirs. And he drinks more frequently which is the desired outcome. We are both happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: noneyet

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice, could hold more
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying automatic everything for the cat so I can get away for the occasional weekend without worrying about him. This holds enough water that one cat is good to go for 2-3 days. Keeps the water filtered and clean so the cat will actually drink it. There is a bit of a hum from the pump, but it isn't too noisy, about like a fish pump. I wish it held a bit more water, but it's adequate for what I need. I worry about it running dry over a weekend and burning out the pump, but hasn't happened yet.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: I just got this fountain within the last couple of weeks. Already the pump is ready to go. I clean the fountain and change the water daily, so I know nothing has gotten in it. Very disappointing. Not worth me paying the postage to send it back, very frustrating. I have a cat with kidney issues and she needs a working water fountain. This is not going to last very long. I expected more. I would not recommend, would have given zero stars, but I couldn't.
customer_reviews.author: dogsmom

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: Assembly is easy, cleaning is easy (minimal crevices) and my cats love it. There's no splashing and my normally skittish cat had a much easier time adjusting than with our last fountain. The noise level is extremely low and you can adjust the strength at which the pump pushes water around. The filters that come with this are easy to find and don't break the bank, either, which is why we had to look for a new fountain in the first place. Just make sure you rinse the filter well before using for the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Manda

customer_reviews.title: My cat likes it
customer_reviews.text: I like the three tier levels of this fountain. My cat seems to like to drink from all three options. I also like the 70 oz capacity, I only have to refill it every few days. I have found that it requires cleaning weekly, it gets slimy pretty quick. This is the first time however that I dismantled and cleaned the pump, and it definitely needed it. There is a label attached to the power cord which details how to dismantle and clean the pump (pretty simple). Also the filter pops apart easily and can be cleaned as well.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Great fountain!
customer_reviews.text: Cheap price, great quality, easy to assemble, easy to clean, quiet. Replacement filters reasonably priced. Most important - our finicky cat uses it! Cheap enough that I bought a second one, so when I clean the first one (soak pump impeller in water/vinegar for a couple hours) I just set the second one up. Tried an expensive ceramic one that was a nightmare to try and put together. Returned it and bought this one. Parts fit together perfectly and its a very simple design.
customer_reviews.author: Cejhome

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality. Do NOT buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of this fountain in 1.5 years! The first one lasted a bit more than 1 year and died. That was ok. I liked it so i bought a new one. The second one lasted like 2 months then the motor started losing power. The water flowed really really slow even at max speed. So I bought the 3rd one. The same problem happened again after 2 months. The water flowed very very slowly. And I changed filter every 4 weeks and cleaned the fountain every week! Do NOT buy this foundation.
customer_reviews.author: -J.

customer_reviews.title: Simple & excellent design / easy clean
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this CatMate fountain to replace an older PetSafe DrinkWell that was getting pretty scuzzy & leaking a little bit. Although I liked the PetSafe product okay, I thought I’d try something different. My Conclusion: This CatMate Fountain is so much simpler in design: easier to clean, easier to fill, less expensive, and the cats seem to like it just as much. I’ve only had it for a couple weeks, so I can’t attest to it’s long term durability, but for now, I’m very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: jchipps

customer_reviews.title: Works but is time consuming to clean
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this cat fountain along with filters to encourage my senior cat to drink more water. That part has worked. However, the fountain required dismantling, including motor parts ( ie opening top of motor ) to completely keep the parts from getting slimy. I do this 2-3 times a week and it takes a lot of time. The filters are useless for me and are just another thing to clean. If you use bottled or filtered water, you should be fine without filters. Nonetheless, if you are worried about your pet's health, you should thoroughly clean this entire unit often.
customer_reviews.author: clm

customer_reviews.title: Silent, easy to clean, cats use it!
customer_reviews.text: There are lots of pet water fountains to choose from. Since this was my cats' first experience with one, I wanted to make sure I got one that had multiple options. This one has a large pool of water to drink from a lot like the water bowls they were familiar with. It took some time but all 3 cats are drinking from it. I add water to it every other day and clean it once a week. Very easy to clean and almost completely silent. I have a cat who is easily spooked and he doesn't notice a sound at all. I am happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Carabella

customer_reviews.title: Not pretty but works well
customer_reviews.text: Not the prettiest fountain for your hike, but you already knew that from the picture. My 2 cats love it and drink out of it all the time. It comes apart easily for cleaning, and you will need to clean it about once a week. Pump is pretty quiet (unless the water gets too low and it sucks air) and adjustable from bubbling spring to gushing waterfall. The design does minimize splashing. One of my cats is kinda dumb and will reach across the unit to get to the well he wants or stick his face in the flow, so added bonus for comedy. Filter keeps water clean. Needs replacement about 3-4 weeks depending on how dirty the surroundings are
customer_reviews.author: J-whi

customer_reviews.title: Makes noise when filter needs to be rinsed...
customer_reviews.text: My kitties like this water fountain. For the most part it doesn't make much noise, unless the water level starts to get too low... but you have to rinse out the filter (or replace it) at least once every couple of weeks, or the fountain starts to get very noisy. It is also pretty hard to clean, because of all the small nooks and crannies, so I had to get a little bottle-cleaner brush to scrub out those areas. All in all, it works well and my kitties use it faithfully.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca H.

customer_reviews.title: Lowest price for a decent fountain
customer_reviews.text: Quiet, well thought out design. Everything disassembles easily for cleaning. I pulled it out of the box and put it to use, that was a small mistake, the filter is wrapped and sealed in plastic to keep it's carbon fresh! Unit makes a slight purring noise seemed to get quieter after it ran awhile. Can only hear it if the room is silent, ie. if the refrigerator is running. Cat took to it immediately. My vet has been on me to get a fountain to encourage him to drink more water.Filters are as low as $5 for two. [...]
customer_reviews.author: skicanoe

customer_reviews.title: Great for cat
customer_reviews.text: Like others have said. My cat now drinks twice as much as she used too. Which makes me feel bad since she’s 11 and that means she’s been dehydrated for 11 years. But she has it now and she loves it. It is mildly noisy if you have it in a room with you. Like as half or 1/4 as loud as a microwave.
customer_reviews.author: aronf_53

customer_reviews.title: Awesome fountain!
customer_reviews.text: We had been a different brand cat fountain for a decade. It was quite a bit bigger, more difficult to clean. considerably noisier and the filters were much more expensive. I had some concerns about the size of this fountain as it is definitely smaller than our previous fountain, but we love this fountain. It was a breeze to assemble, we'll save enough on filters to pay for the fountain and it extremely quiet! Definitely a five * product in our opinion!
customer_reviews.author: Crusty

customer_reviews.title: My cats love it!
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this fountain!! Not only does it have two moving pools of water and a little waterfall, they have fun with it! The best fun is watching it in the morning when I clean and reload it. They wait for the water to come up in the first pool and start down the slide to the big pool. Granted my cats are entertained by anything that moves but this is just heaven for them and I find they are enjoying drinking water more which is so important. It's a great fountain, easy to clean and reload. I love the attachment to the main plug which makes it so easy to.move around. Great price!
customer_reviews.author: HABU122

customer_reviews.title: Needs cleaned daily but works like a charm.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my cats as we were going out of town and I wanted them to be okay with water. It worked wonderfully.. the only issue is it keeps getting dirty every single day and I have to clean it. If I didn't have a second one that's another brand that keeps clean for about a week I wouldn't realize that was a problem... but it's a bit annoying having to take it apart daily to clean it. It started this within a week of purchasing so I doubt it is the filter.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Calderhead

customer_reviews.title: The filters are wonderful. My (apparently) extended cat family is happy
customer_reviews.text: Someone left their 2 cats with me for a couple of days. As I already had 2 cats, the water was completely icky. (Picture trying to drink the backwash from 3 other people in your water. Yuck!!) I've had this(and the extra cats) for over a year. It does take a few minutes to wash, but who cares. Their water is clean. The filters are wonderful. My (apparently) extended cat family is happy. That makes me happy. Take 10 minutes to wash it out by hand occasionally and replace the filters. It will serve you well!! After a year and a half, I still love this. My cats do too!
customer_reviews.author: Richie Carrillo

customer_reviews.title: Cats love the water fountain
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in the beginning of 2019 - it still would great, easy to clean if you have the right tools. I've noticed that the tube bringing the water to the top of the fountain gets that pink slimy gunk, but it's easily removable with a long thin brush. I do find that I have to add water to the fountain nearly every day, as are cats seem to love to drink out of it. I was worried that the motor is going to kick the bucket, but to my surprise it's still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel K.

customer_reviews.title: Just got my third one
customer_reviews.text: My fussy Siberian hates water bowls, and wasn't getting enough to drink. I bought this and she loved it. It worked for three years before the pump broke. For the price, I just replaced the whole unit. We got another cat last year, so I wanted another fountain. I got a nice steel bowl fountain, which cost more but was easier to clean. They hate it, and use it rarely. I'm back to buy another of these to put in the dining room because it's a hot summer. I have a fussy Siberian, and a spoiled Ragdoll. This is the only fountain they like.
customer_reviews.author: Dani Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Motor breaks after a year.  TWICE!!
customer_reviews.text: Here's the thing, my cats love this fountain and I did too at first. After a year, the motor died. Tried another fountain, they refused to drink from it. Bought this again in May 2018...motor just died again. Now, I'm forced to buy this defective merchandise again so that I can have healthy cats.
customer_reviews.author: MzBee

customer_reviews.title: Very Pet Friendly, adequate amount of water reserved and quiet operation
customer_reviews.text: The size of the drinking area is very large for all types of muzzles to get in and drink from. Four drinking zones for any size animal, easy filter access and replacement. Quiet operation with very little water splash and noise. After trying a more expensive style Water fountain that my cats did not drink from, I am very pleased with this Fountain and both my cats immediately started to use this fountain like it was perfectly natural to drink from.
customer_reviews.author: Sono-sanTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: New frog puddle
customer_reviews.text: I have tree frogs on my front porch. I live in Florida so bugs hanging aroung the front door can be a problem. I encourge tree frogs so they will help with that. I had a bird bath on the porch but it became old and in the summer was high maintenace. The new water fountain was an instant hit with my pals. The next day there were frog paw marks all over the fountain and the evaporation rate is not nearly that of the bird bath. And no noise. Just perfection.
customer_reviews.author: Mia

customer_reviews.title: Cats Will Not Use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and fill, but the hum from the motor is noticeable (almost as loud as a nearby wine fridge) and one of my cats is afraid of it. He will drink from another brand of fountain that has no hum, but not from this one. Another cat initially drank from the Cat Mate fountain, but now has stopped. Both cats also prefer a stainless steel mixing bowl to this fountain, so I'm going to unplug it and give up. I wanted to like this fountain, but it's more important that the cats like it ... and they don't.
customer_reviews.author: SROVirginia

customer_reviews.title: This Pet Fountain is SOOO QUIET!!
customer_reviews.text: This pet fountain is SOOO QUIET! Can't really hear it unless u get extremely close-up. Easy to assemble and good instructions. My cat is a bit afraid of it. I unplugged it for a day and she started to drink from it a little. Hopefully she will grow to like it. My only concern is that the wall plug gets pretty warm after being plugged in for a while. It's probably normal, I'm just paranoid. It is a great quality fountain!
customer_reviews.author: Lori H.

customer_reviews.title: Great, while it works
customer_reviews.text: IF YOU BUY THIS, MAKE SURE YOU REGISTER YOUR FOUNTAIN WITHIN 14 DAYS OF PURCHASE. First the pump failed (after just 3 months of use, and careful attention to making sure that the water level was topped off & the filter changed, as directed). Then the transformer failed after 4.5 months. If the fountain is no longer under warranty, it's cheaper to buy a new fountain from Amazon than order parts from Pet Mate (after they tack on exorbitant costs for shipping & handling). From what I can tell, the Drinkwell fountains use the same pump and transformer, so switching to a different manufacturer isn't going to help.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Scutero

customer_reviews.title: Now my cat drinks more water
customer_reviews.text: Before I buy this, I noticed my cat drinks a lot from my fish tank. I thought maybe wants to drink from moving water as it's instincts dictate. I bought this fountain. It's quite and encouraged my cat to drink more water and each time he stays drinking longer (like a minute or two). Before, he just touched his bowl of water. I change the water everyday and put him filtered cool water which proved attracting to him. I've had it for 10 days now so I can't speak for its long-term performance .
customer_reviews.author: Sherif M.

customer_reviews.title: Best water fountain for cats
customer_reviews.text: My cats absolutely love this water fountain. I was hesitant because they are both older and I have tried other fountains before. I love that this has a water slide rather than water splashing down. My cats have been drinking much more water than they had from a bowl. It is super easy to clean because it has a quick disconnect so you do not have to unplug it from the wall each time you clean it. The assembly is super fast and allows for easy cleaning. I would recommend this to anyone with kitties.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlynn Arocha

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it
customer_reviews.text: To be honest, every toy or device is going to be a coin flip with a cat - they will either love it or ignore it. All four cats use it, and I think the different height levels are a reason it is so attractive to them. The noise level when it is full is very low, and when it makes noise, you need to top it off. No water filter is super easy to clean, you have to be vigilant with them, but this one does have a very good design and I like the small filters.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Two thumbs up and an air snap
customer_reviews.text: We had initially bought this after an expensive trip to the vet hospital, as a way to encourage our cat to drink more water. And i dont know how it does it or why the running water works but it works! Our cat drinks regularly from this where he didnt drink at all before. So if youre trying to get your lion or lioness to drink ....i give it the two thumbs up and an air snap!
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda

customer_reviews.title: Good value, I think (Well, maybe not)
customer_reviews.text: This is a nicely made product that doesn't cost a lot. Even the replacement filters are cheap and easy to replace. I've only had it a week, so I don't know if it will last. But my initial impression is very positive. UPDATE: After a week, the pump started gurgling. I took it apart and thoroughly cleaned it, but it didn't help. Its now too loud to use, so it looks like it's trash unless I can find a replacement pump.
customer_reviews.author: Snugs

customer_reviews.title: Broke in two months
customer_reviews.text: My cat LOVED this at first and I debated buying another one but the cord ripped in two months (right when the return window closed of course). SO disappointed, what a waste of money. Also the filters got dirty really really easily (MUCH quicker than the 2 flower fountains Ive had-one before this and the one I bought after it) and had to be changed nearly every week with only one cat in a really clean apartment
customer_reviews.author: LolaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: Just bought my second one of these. I had the first one for 6 months. My cats liked it so much I thought another would be a good idea. They all drink so much water, they love this thing. It hums a bit but its not unpleasant. With 3 cats I was filling it once a day but I recently adopted a 4th and thats when I felt the second was very necessary. Cats love it. I change the filter once a month. You can tell when it needs the filter changed. It's very low maitnence. Be sure to clean out the fountain area with a tooth brush or straw cleaning brush to get rid of built up slime.

customer_reviews.title: Loud!
customer_reviews.text: For the first month or so, this product worked GREAT! Since then it constantly makes an air surge sound like a "WHHHHAAAAA" and just keeps repeating. No amount of changing filter, cleaning the powering device, cleaning the "shoot" where the water rises stops this irritating noise. I can hear it throughout the house; that is how loud it is. The cats like it, but I do not.
customer_reviews.author: TragicRushFan

customer_reviews.title: Great filter, quiet and cats love it
customer_reviews.text: Our cats love this. They used to complain and want to drink out of the faucet, bathtub, and essentially anything but their dish. Now they all drink out of this. You do need to clean it somewhat regularly, and I do recommend using regular tap water rather than filtered water as the chlorine helps keep slime from forming after long times. You will also need to change filters out every once and a while but its super easy.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Skinner

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product & company
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had to clean it deeply yet, but what sold me initially on this product was the video showing the product in the dishwasher. I imagine it will be as advertised bc everything else about this product has been above and beyond. The company seems to actually care about the well being of my pets. They contacted us making sure things were good after purchasing. And my cats (2 young male cats) love the fountain. They seem much healthier now that their hydration is adequate. It is quiet enough but most importantly I love how much they seem to love it.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Webb

customer_reviews.title: Best pet fountain by far.
customer_reviews.text: I'm buying this as a replacement for a 5-year old version that has become scratched over time but is still going strong. I had tried other fountains and this one is definitely the best. It's easy to clean (I do it every two days) and my cat loves drinking from it, especially the top. She's a Maine Coon and I suspect that the upper "pool" better suits her big size. I appreciate the disconnect plug part way up the cord so that I don't have to unplug the transformer for each cleaning and that it doesn't have to go into the cleaning water - a great design feature. I buy the filters and change them every few months.
customer_reviews.author: Joan Dupont

customer_reviews.title: Cat Mate is a trusted brand for my home
customer_reviews.text: My oh my! I love this fountain! I have two cats who use this. My Veterinarian requested that I get my eldest (16) a fountain to reduce the risk of UTI's, stomach/kidney problems, it took 0 amount of time for them to get used to it. As soon as they were thirsty they went straight over to it without hesitation. There is a humm but it's less than the sound a fish aquarium makes in my opinion.The filters are reasonable, cleaning is a breeze, and its a healthier option. The size it perfect for my 2, it sits perfectly next to the entry way to the hall in my home. I recommend it with 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it, I have mixed feelings
customer_reviews.text: The cats drink water out of it like crazy, but the thing constantly gets a thin layer of calcium build up on it, so I am scrubbing it every 3-4 days. If you do pick it up, make sure to buy a brush set to go with it, you will certainly need it. Otherwise the noise level is fine and it holds a good amount of water.... it just is constantly in need of scrubbing. If the cats didn't drink more water from it than a stagnant bowl I would switch back to a normal water bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Works well and a good design, but probably too "neat" for my kitty ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well and a good design, but probably too "neat" for my kitty who still prefers the faucets in the sinks. I am thinking of constructing some kind of obstacle or tube in the waterfall section to make it more like the flow that comes out of the faucets. The water does move, so I suspect that other cats may find it enjoyable.She used it about a half dozen times then when back to the sinks. And you can't beat the price. It does need to be within a few feet of an electrical outlet.
customer_reviews.author: maryvanblarcom

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Encourages My Cat To Drink!
customer_reviews.text: I have a young cat, Etta Mae Wilson, that suffers with terrible constipation problems. I did some research and found that sometimes moving water is an enticement to cats to drink. I never used to see Etta Mae at the water bowl, but she is constantly drinking now from this cat fountain. She is now on a very strict vet prescribed diet and doing better, but the best prescription is water and she is now getting it! Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet, easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: We had one of the teardrop shaped stainless steel water fountains but it was always difficult to clean and quite noisy. And after nine months it started getting hard lime build up frequently, so we had to clean it much more often. One of my neighbors had this model and I was amazed how quiet it was and she also showed me that it was very easy to clean. So we got one of these, and it is much quieter than the previous model sitting in the exact same location. The cats seem to like it fine. And hopefully the monthly cleaning will continue to be easy. Very pleased so far.
customer_reviews.author: D Calvin

customer_reviews.title: One of my best pet purchases
customer_reviews.text: This water fountain is GREAT. I have just one cat, but I am away for most of the day, so I like to make sure he has an abundant water source. When full, you can't hear the filter at all! No annoying buzzing and the waterfall barely makes a trickling noise. I like that it holds enough water for me to refill once every 3 days and it keeps it fresh and clean of dust/dirt versus standing water. My favorite part is that it keeps the water cool so it is absolutely PERFECT for hot summer days.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne

customer_reviews.title: Small Dog and Cat Love This!
customer_reviews.text: Our dog (18lbs) and cat (7lbs) love this. We decided to look for a pet fountain because our cat was right by us whenever we turned on running water (sink, shower, fridge dispenser). Problem solved. She loves this fountain. And even our dog, who had no problem drinking out of a water bowl prefers this. I was originally looking at PetSafe model, but decided to go with this one after reading noise complaints with the other brand. This one is SO quiet. Don't hear a thing. I had the motor running without water and didn't notice for a few second because it's THAT quiet. Absolutely perfect. So glad we went with this. And you can't beat the price!
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Stewart

customer_reviews.title: My cat prefers this over the toilet bowl!
customer_reviews.text: This is great! It stopped my cat from drinking out of the toilet! He didn't want standing water in the bowl. No matter how often we cleaned the bowl and refreshed the water, he wanted to sip from the toilet instead. So, I decided to give this a try - he's a large cat, but he drinks from all 3 levels. The only bad thing is that the pump can get clogged fairly easily and not work. You can clean the pump yourself and get it working again. The fountain comes with instructions, but I did not think they were that clear. So, I looked up a video and that cleared the process up for me and did that trick.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Manheim

customer_reviews.title: Cats and I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after looking at several cat fountain types. This design seemed the least obtrusive (didn't want the flower one) and easy to use/clean. I've had it for 6mo now and have no complaints. Works well, motor is quiet, holds a large amount of water - plenty for my 2 kitties, easy to clean. Make sure you take the motor apart in the way that the sticker tag tells you to get all the gunk out. I also bought the filter replacements and replace every 2mo.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Love the simplicity
customer_reviews.text: Very simple to assemble and use. Leaves a lot of room for the cats to drink from. I have three cats and two of them instantly took a liking to it. There is room for all three of them to drink at the same time. The noise level is about the same, if not quieter, then the fountain with the flower in the middle. It is much easier to clean though. I hope it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: The S Family

customer_reviews.title: Pets love it; never going back to a water bowl
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my new kitten when I noticed he was drinking from the toilet. He still drinks from the toilet if we leave the seat up, but he definitely likes the fountain more than the stagnant bowl of water. My dog likes it too, although she never made a fuss about stagnant water. It's fairly easy to clean. Manual comes with troubleshooting steps if the pump gets clogged. Shouldn't get clogged as long as you're cleaning it regularly (every 2-4 weeks, depending on how many pets you have). You can find replacement filters on Amazon for a few dollars.
customer_reviews.author: HL

customer_reviews.title: Best Cat Fountain! Quiet and Easy Cleaning!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best water fountain! Was hesitant to buy one after my first experience with a different cat fountain didn’t go as planned. But the cats love this! The three levels is a great feature and they love drinking the filtered water. It’s quiet!!! Easy to set up, easy to clean, easy to see when the water is getting low, and when I need to add water to it, I just fill a glass with water and pour it in. One of my cats would only drink out of a drinking glass, but she loves this fountain. Even our large dog likes to drink from it. Great price and I would suggest to anyone to give this a try!
customer_reviews.author: LemonShops

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 3 weeks!
customer_reviews.text: **EDIT:** very disappointed unfortunately this did NOT last.. the fountain stopped working and was constantly making very loud noise. Now the motor has completely stopped. I took it all apart and cleaned everything.. I was hoping that would fix the issue but sadly it did not. I will be returning and back on the hunt for a new fountain. I highly suggest paying more for a higher quality fountain.
customer_reviews.author: Jay S

customer_reviews.title: Cats Love Fountain, But I'm Disappointed in Performance
customer_reviews.text: My 2 cats love the fountain; however, after only having this one for 5 months, I was very disappointed when the pump stopped working. I was doing my weekly cleaning of the fountain and changing the filter, but when I plugged it back in nothing happened. I took it apart again, checked the pump and made certain it was set correctly, then plugged it in again and still nothing happened. I very disappointed especially since I just ordered and received several filters. I don't want to waste these filters, so I guess I'll have to order another Cat Mate fountain, but when the filters are gone or the pump dies again, I will not be buying another one.
customer_reviews.author: Susan A. Ford

customer_reviews.title: Not sure but my cat likes her old dish better.
customer_reviews.text: She is slowly using this one that I think is better. But I'm a people and have not figured out the mentality of cats. They are all so different and fascinating. This big girl has been here 4 years and used the older fountain 2 years. This one is quieter and the water doesn't ripple as much. Not sure if that would make a difference. I like it.and perhaps soon she will too.
customer_reviews.author: MJP

customer_reviews.title: We would recommend
customer_reviews.text: We have been very pleased with this fountain, which we first bought in 2011. The pump died this year, and we found a replacement pump online. Since the pump cost more than half the great Amazon price (LOVE YOU AMAZON PRIME), and since this fountain has operated quietly and efficiently for more than 3 years, we opted to replace. These days, three years out of a small, relatively inexpensive appliance is pretty darn good. You do have to clean the filter regularly to keep it going, but it has been good for us and our cats enjoy it a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Donna DeLuca

customer_reviews.title: There Are Better Options Out There
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to clean and reassemble. The pump often didn’t work after reassembly, so I would have to take it apart again and really push on the pump so the suction cups would stick and the pump would work. My cats didn’t like this fountain. After now having a fountain they do like, I think it has something to do with the flow of the water and the overall design of the fountain.
customer_reviews.author: TJ Cole

customer_reviews.title: This is a very effective device to help kitty stay hydrated.
customer_reviews.text: This product probably has helped me to avoid a vet bill! My four year old male cat has never drank very much water from his water dish but he would race my husband to the bathroom sink for a drink from the faucet. There Rascal would take very long drinks . We figured that Rascal liked the sound of the running water besides being thirsty. After setting up the pet fountain both male cats are very well hydrated and they don't beg for drinks at the faucet. The fountain make a suttle trickling sound and my cats love to drink from it!
customer_reviews.author: Ms K

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, great design, and the cats love it
customer_reviews.text: The cats love it! They like drinking out of all three areas. The design catches big items and hair before they get to the filter or pump. The pump seems to stay cleaner than it did with an older fountain by another brand. The filter catches anything smaller than misses the first catcher. The water needs to be refilled more frequently, but I'm not sure if that's because the cats drink from it more or if the water is evaporating more quickly - probably a combination of the two. It's very quiet and easy to clean. I wish I had bought it sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Claygirlsings

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves this!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best Christmas present my cat has ever got. He loves it! He always drinks from the top pool. And he even waits for it when I am cleaning it. You can buy replacement filters for this. I have had this a few years and it still works great. You do need to clean the motor now and then if you notice it not pumping water well enough. It is easy to open up and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: This may be better for a 1 pet home
customer_reviews.text: Used but then gave up on the cleaning. The white part is not too hard to clean - Underneath where the fittings hook the 2 bowls take some time.........However it is the pump that did me in... filled up within 4 days (2 cats 2 dogs) had to take the pump completely apart to get the gunk out of the inside. This may be better for a 1 pet home. Item worked I think as intended was just surprised how fast the pump got yucky...even with changing the water every 2 days. oh well
customer_reviews.author: Tlea

customer_reviews.title: what seems like a lot to me
customer_reviews.text: I would have given 5 stars, my only problem that it makes noise, and it has to be filled, what seems like a lot to me. I have to fill it at least 2-3 times a week. But the noise isn't terribly loud, (just wish it was silent) and as long as you keep it filled, it's quieter. Also, I will say, it passed a accidental test. My cats knocked a hoodie into the dish over night, so when I found it in the morning, it was completely absorbed, leaving the fountain empty. I filled it immediately, and didn't have any problems. I would have thought that would kill the motor, but it didn't.
customer_reviews.author: elaine

customer_reviews.title: Great unit and really great value. Well made.
customer_reviews.text: Cats love it. Sometimes they drink from the top, sometimes the bottom. Water seems a lot cleaner. Easy set up and quiet. Cord is really long and has a place near the unit where it unhooks so you can move it to clean--don't have to unplug all the way to the wall. Really glad I got this one. Hope it holds up well.
customer_reviews.author: Friendly Midwesterner

customer_reviews.title: Great product,  recommend if you have cats
customer_reviews.text: I have three cats, when I first got this product they were hesitant, but then they loved it. My males like the top part and my female, likes the running water. They also all drink from the bottom pool. I found that cleaning with a waterpick gets all the crannies, being in the southern US and with hard water, mold can grown quickly. I clean it once or twice a week. My cats love it.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Ransom

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, easy to clean. Good waterer, good price
customer_reviews.text: I love this waterer! Quiet, keeps water moving, cats are adjusting. They were pretty freaked out by this initially so I turned it off for a couple of weeks. When I turned it back on, I put it on the lowest setting and they seem to be drinking from it. One of my cats has a urinary problem so I am hoping this will entice him to drink more. Hard to tell, but even if he doesn't this is still a very nice, quiet machine. Also easy to clean and straight forward operation.
customer_reviews.author: notsoplain

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last long
customer_reviews.text: I bought this July 13 and it worked beautifully for about 3 months. The cats loved it! All of a sudden it doesn't work any longer. it makes noise like it is working, but the water doesn't flow from the fountain. I followed all directions for cleaning and replacing filters, but it stopped working anyway. This is very disappointing and I am completely unhappy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce S, Spence

customer_reviews.title: easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: So much easier to clean than other fountains I have used. It is quiet until it needs cleaning or the water level is low, and then it is not a loud noise, just noticable. I wish you could choose to have the lower waterfall be stronger so it comes off the surface a bit, more like a faucet. Otherwise my cat and I love it!
customer_reviews.author: TanK

customer_reviews.title: he doesn't like drinking water from a standard dish
customer_reviews.text: My cat is extremely picky with his water, he doesn't like drinking water from a standard dish. This has increased the amount of water he drinks the only problem is the filter is pretty cheap and doesn't really "filter" the water. Since I bought this because he love running water it was exactly what I was looking for, if you are looking for something to filter the water you might want to get a more expensive one. Pros: Easy to clean Increase water intake for your cat Long cord Multiple drinking areas Cons: Filter is pretty cheap, some dirt will just go around it
customer_reviews.author: Jon Johnson

customer_reviews.title: My cat was very happy with his fountain until it just stopped working one ...
customer_reviews.text: My cat was very happy with his fountain until it just stopped working one day. We ordered a replacement and that one broke just 4 days after we got it. The problem seems to be with the cored that plugs into the motor. We will return the one we just bought, but I don't think we will have any options for original one we bought. Our cat is spoiled and only like to drink the flowing water, so I will be buying a different brand that will hopefully last.
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: Kitties are intrigued and drinking more
customer_reviews.text: My kitties aren't sure what to think about their new water dish, but overall, I do believe they're drinking more, and it's entertaining too, watching them dip their paws into the moving water. Funny. Very quiet once it's filled up and moving.
customer_reviews.author: Benjifer sells

customer_reviews.title: Too loud for my situation.
customer_reviews.text: I live in a 2 bedroom apartment with a roommate so I have to keep my cat stuff in my room. The noise level made it not ideal for situation. I expected a fountain sound, which is quite nice, but there is also some electoral noise as well as the pump. Even over a white noise machine. Had to return, though if I had a room where the noise didn’t matter, I would have kept it. My cat liked it.
customer_reviews.author: Braxton

customer_reviews.title: Best fountain I have used
customer_reviews.text: My brother got me this for Christmas one year and my cat loved it. It is good at enticing the cat to use it and it is easy to clean. To keep it clean and quiet just clean it once a week at least and refresh the water, check daily to make sure it is above the minimum fill line. I have tried other fountains and my cat only likes this one. A tip for encouraging drinking is using cold water to mimic a stream in the wild.
customer_reviews.author: B Wright

customer_reviews.title: Silent and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Our cats love this! One cat likes to drink out of the top and one prefers the bottom, so having the different water levels is nice. It's completely silent and very easy to take apart and clean, even the pump mechanism. Regular cleaning is necessary otherwise the inside compartment may grow mold (I assume from little bits of food slipping past the filter cartridge and sitting in the dark), but at least it's an easy process.
customer_reviews.author: Dalton

customer_reviews.title: and the two small dogs and cat love it. There are four ways to get a ...
customer_reviews.text: We had other fountain type water bowls and this one is the most quiet so far. We have it for a few weeks, and the two small dogs and cat love it. There are four ways to get a drink, and the cat tried all four! its a toy to her, and her water is very important to her. We put distilled water in the unit, but still use the filters, to filter out their slobber - since they all drink from this.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Kitties love but refuse to clean themselves
customer_reviews.text: Cats give it 5 stars, I give it 2, and since they refuse to get day jobs or do chores, my review wins. They love the water trickle. I hate that the filter and entire dish get full of gooey crud and need to be scrubbed out constantly. I even had to take a bobby pin to it in places to get it out of the slats of the motor. Filters quickly become cesspools, and you have to buy many replacements. Clever. I wouldn't buy this again, but will keep it until the motor dies and then find a better one. If you do buy this, set those filters to autoship and save yourself the trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: My cats actually drink from it
customer_reviews.text: I spent a lot of time researching fountains. The first one I purchased worked well but my cats didn't drink from it very much. This fountain is great. It looks a little like the bathroom sink (where the like to drink from), it's totally quiet, and no obnoxious light. My 2 cats seem to really like it and drink more water, now. This was a great purchase for me.
customer_reviews.author: Momma P

customer_reviews.title: Cat Now Drinks Water!
customer_reviews.text: Our cat never used to drink water, and it worried us...a lot. My husband did a lot of research and found this fountain to be the best option based on reviews and price. Our cat drinks a lot more water now! One downside to the fountain is that it gets slimy. I clean it once a week (maybe it should be more!), and the plastic is always slimy. The filter gets slimy too. Granted, this could absolutely be out water, but I'm using filtered water that's then filtered again, so I wouldn't expect that result.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and compact water fountain
customer_reviews.text: Quiet and fits perfectly on my edged placemat. My cat prefers to drink from the top since it is up high (not too high, though). While water does circulate, the filter doesn't catch/or do much so frequent water changes are necessary. It's easy to clean and appreciate the quick release on the cord ( you can leave the outlet piece in the wall). Make sure you have brushes to clean the inside well.
customer_reviews.author: JSMom

customer_reviews.title: It’s not bad
customer_reviews.text: My cats aren’t really sure what to do with this. I think they are a little weirded out by it. I wanted it to keep the water fresh which I think it does although their food collects on the one side of it (it’s Right next to their food bowel so it gets in the water). I thought my one cat might enjoy playing with it since he loves the sink and shower but he doesn’t show much interest other than the occasional drink. So I guess it serves its purpose of providing the freshest water possible.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good one!
customer_reviews.text: Cats like to drink water from this water fountain. I guess the height and shape of it is designed right. I notice my cats love to drink from glass bowls too and they love water from bottles ( 40 bottle for 3.5$ at Costco). I wish this water fountain come in glass material.. It is easy to clean. I have been using one for years and the pump still work!
customer_reviews.author: catlady

customer_reviews.title: but I think my cats would enjoy more trickle and less flow
customer_reviews.text: My cats were drinking out of any water source other than their bowl and I decided to give this a try. Pros: It holds quite a bit of water It's quiet It stays cleaner than I thought it would, and Fliters are not that expensive and last quite a while My cats have stopped drinking out of the sink, toilet, random glasses with water on the coffee table or desks Con: The water flows instead of trickles (which is obvious in the pictures), which makes it very quiet, but I think my cats would enjoy more trickle and less flow
customer_reviews.author: N. M. Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Good design and easy to clean. I'd buy it again
customer_reviews.text: This fountain is nicely designed with rounded corners that help make it easy to clean. It is sturdy and fits together well. Easy to assemble. The filter is pretty quiet and has adjustable speed (flow rate). Even at higher speed, it is quiet as long as the water level is kept full. My cats are drinking more and I wish I had bought this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: michael d

product_meta.title: Cat Mate Pet Fountain - 70 Fluid Oz.
product_meta.description: Color:WhiteYour pets's health and vitality require adequate water consumption. Our carefully developed, unique design is exceptionally
feature_bullets: I.P.S. (Isolated Pump System) for super-quiet operation
Polymer-carbon filter for water purification (replacement cartridges available

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars3,914 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
